reviews.text: on tap at modry abbe, the kacov pub in prague and vinarna hrozen. possibly my favourite kvasnicovy. dullish honey colour, lasting creamy head, amazing ly salty and fresh aroma of nettles and various other plants that sting, smoked ham, a butcher after a hard day at work. quite zoigl like - chalky, prickly, buttery texture, reasonable bitterness. awesome stuff
Bottle 0.5l. Clear, amber colored. AROMA- very low, apples, honey, caramel, bread crusts. FLAVOR- semi-sweet, lightly bitter, bread crusts with some caramel notes. Light to medium bodied.Not bad.
Beer served from tap, with light color, not much foam, average carbonation, light body.
